00004  *  Random arbitrary insertion (RAI) TSP heuristic.

00012 /****************************************************************************
00013  * Private function prototypes

00015 /**
00016  *  @brief  Given a set of nodes to insert, inserts them as cheaply
00017  *          as possible into a partial tour.
00018  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00019  *  @param  solve_btsp [in] if ARROW_TRUE, attempts to construct tour by
00020  *              minimizing the maximum cost, otherwise constructs tour by
00021  *              minimizing the largest cost
00022  *  @param  node_list [in] the list of nodes to insert into the partial tour
00023  *  @param  list_size [in] the number of nodes in the node list
00024  *  @param  tour [out] initially a partial tour, at termination is a
00025  *              full tour of n nodes
00026  *  @param  length [out] the length of the tour (or largest cost in tour
00027  *              if solve_btsp = ARROW_TRUE)
00028  *  @param  ins_list [out] a temporary array of pointers to linked list items
00029  */
00030 void
00031 construct_tour(arrow_problem *problem, int solve_btsp, int *node_list, 
00032                int list_size, arrow_llist *tour, double *length,
00033                arrow_llist_item **ins_list);
00034 
00035 /**
00036  *  @brief  Attempts to improve upon the given tour by removing a random path
00037  *          and reinserting the removed nodes in a random order as cheaply as
00038  *          possible..
00039  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00040  *  @param  solve_btsp [in] if ARROW_TRUE, attempts to construct tour by
00041  *              minimizing the maximum cost, otherwise constructs tour by
00042  *              minimizing the largest cost
00043  *  @param  best_tour [out] the best tour found so far; if a better tour is
00044  *              found this pointer will be changed to point to the new best
00045  *              tour
00046  *  @param  length [out] the length of the tour (or largest cost in tour
00047  *              if solve_btsp = ARROW_TRUE)
00048  *  @param  tour [out] initially a partial tour, at termination is a
00049  *              full tour of n nodes
00050  *  @param  ins_list [out] a temporary array of pointers to linked list items
00051  *  @param  node_list [out] temporary array of integers of size n
00052  */           
00053 void
00054 improve_tour(arrow_problem *problem, int solve_btsp, arrow_llist *best_tour, 
00055             double *length, arrow_llist *tour, arrow_llist_item **ins_list, 
00056             int *node_list);
00057 
00058 /**
00059  *  @brief  Returns the min of the two values
00060  *  @param  i [in] first number
00061  *  @param  j [in] second number
00062  *  @return the smallest of i, j
00063  */
00064 int
00065 min2(int i, int j);
00066 
00067 /**
00068  *  @brief  Returns the max of the two values
00069  *  @param  i [in] first number
00070  *  @param  j [in] second number
00071  *  @return the largest of i, j
00072  */
00073 int
00074 max2(int i, int j);
00075 
00076 /**
00077  *  @brief  Returns the max of the three values
00078  *  @param  i [in] first number
00079  *  @param  j [in] second number
00080  *  @param  k [in] third number
00081  *  @return the largest of i, j, k
00082  */
00083 int
00084 max3(int i, int j, int k);

00087 /****************************************************************************
00088  * Public function implementations
00089  ****************************************************************************/
00090 int 
00091 arrow_tsp_rai_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_tsp_rai_params *params, 
00092                     arrow_tsp_result *result)
00093 {
00094     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00095     int i, u, v;
00096     double length;
00097     int *order = NULL;
00098     int n = problem->size;
00099     double start_time, end_time;
00100     arrow_llist best_tour;
00101     arrow_llist tour;
00102     arrow_llist_item **ins_list = NULL;
00103     
00104     /* Print out RAI parameters */
00105     arrow_debug("RAI Parameters:\n");
00106     arrow_debug(" - Iterations: %d\n", params->iterations);
00107     arrow_debug(" - Solve BTSP?: %s\n", 
00108                 (params->solve_btsp ? "Yes" : "No"));
00109     
00110     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00111     
00112     /* Initialize the arrays */
00113     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &order))
00114         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00115     if((ins_list = malloc(n * sizeof(arrow_llist_item *))) == NULL)
00116     {
00117         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for ins_list array.");
00118         ins_list = NULL;
00119         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00120         goto CLEANUP;
00121     }
00122         
00123     /* Start by creating a random permutation of numbers from 0 to n-1.  This
00124        order will be the order we process nodes for the initial tour */
00125     for(i = 0; i < n; i++) order[i] = i;
00126     arrow_util_permute_array(n, order);
00127     
00128     /* We store our constructed tour in a linked list.  Initially, we insert
00129        the last two nodes from our random permutation, and find the largest
00130        cost in the two node cycle. */
00131     u = order[n - 2];
00132     v = order[n - 1];
00133     arrow_llist_init(&best_tour);
00134     arrow_llist_init(&tour);
00135     arrow_llist_insert_tail(&best_tour, u);
00136     arrow_llist_insert_tail(&best_tour, v);
00137 
00138     /* Using a node-insertion heuristic, build a starting tour in the
00139        cheapest way possible. */
00140     construct_tour(problem, params->solve_btsp, order, n - 2, &best_tour, 
00141                    &length, ins_list);
00142     arrow_debug("Constructed initial tour (length: %.0f)\n", length);
00143     
00144     /* Now we randomly remove chunks from the best tour, replace them into
00145        a new tour, and see if we can get a better solution */
00146     for(i = 1; i <= params->iterations; i++)
00147     {
00148         /* See if we found a tour of length 0 (we stop then!) */
00149         if(length == 0.0)
00150             break;
00151         improve_tour(problem, params->solve_btsp, &best_tour, &length, &tour,
00152                      ins_list, order);
00153     }
00154     arrow_debug("Finished RAI iterations\n");
00155     
00156     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00157     
00158     /* Set results */
00159     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00160     result->obj_value = length;
00161     result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00162     arrow_llist_to_array(&best_tour, result->tour);    
00163     
00164 CLEANUP:
00165     arrow_llist_destruct(&best_tour);
00166     arrow_llist_destruct(&tour);
00167     if(ins_list != NULL) free(ins_list);
00168     if(order != NULL) free(order);
00169     return ret;
00170 }

00173 /****************************************************************************
00174  * Private function implementations
00175  ****************************************************************************/
00176 void
00177 improve_tour(arrow_problem *problem, int solve_btsp, arrow_llist *best_tour, 
00178             double *length, arrow_llist *tour, arrow_llist_item **ins_list, 
00179             int *node_list)
00180 {
00181     int j, u, v;
00182     double new_length;
00183     arrow_llist_item *node;
00184     
00185     /* Pick two nodes at random (can be the same node!) */
00186     u = arrow_util_random_between(0, problem->size - 1);
00187     v = arrow_util_random_between(0, problem->size - 1);
00188     
00189     /* Find u in the linked list */
00190     node = best_tour->head;
00191     while(node != NULL)
00192     {
00193         if(node->data == u)
00194             break;
00195         node = node->next;
00196     }
00197     
00198     /* Start inserting nodes from u to v into an array */
00199     j = 0;
00200     while(1)
00201     {
00202         node_list[j] = node->data;
00203         j++;
00204         
00205         if(node->data == v)
00206             break;    
00207 
00208         if(node->next == NULL)
00209             node = best_tour->head;
00210         else
00211             node = node->next;
00212     }
00213     
00214     /* Ensure linked list is empty */
00215     arrow_llist_destruct(tour);
00216     
00217     /* Insert the rest of the tour into a new linked list */
00218     if(node->next == NULL)
00219         node = best_tour->head;
00220     else
00221         node = node->next;
00222 
00223     while(1)
00224     {
00225         if(node->data == u)
00226             break;
00227         
00228         arrow_llist_insert_tail(tour, node->data);
00229         
00230         if(node->next == NULL)
00231             node = best_tour->head;
00232         else
00233             node = node->next;
00234     }
00235     
00236     /* Determine new insertion order */
00237     arrow_util_permute_array(j, node_list);
00238     
00239     /* Finally, reinsert all those removed nodes back into the tour */
00240     construct_tour(problem, solve_btsp, node_list, j, tour, 
00241                    &new_length, ins_list);
00242     
00243     /* See if we found a better tour */
00244     if(new_length < *length)
00245     {
00246         arrow_debug("Better tour found! (length: %.0f)\n", new_length);
00247         *length = new_length;
00248         arrow_llist_swap(best_tour, tour);
00249     }
00250 }
00251 
00252 void
00253 construct_tour(arrow_problem *problem, int solve_btsp, int *node_list, 
00254                int list_size, arrow_llist *tour, double *length,
00255                arrow_llist_item **ins_list)
00256 {
00257     int i, j, u, v, w;
00258     int cost, in_cost, out_cost;
00259     double best_cost, ins_cost;
00260     int alpha, beta;
00261     arrow_llist_item *node;
00262     
00263     /* If our partial tour has less than two nodes, then we'll pick off the
00264        last two nodes from the randomized node_list until we have at least two
00265        nodes to work with. */
00266     while(tour->size  < 2)
00267     {
00268         arrow_llist_insert_tail(tour, node_list[list_size - 1]);
00269         list_size--;
00270     }
00271     
00272     /* If we're solving for the BTSP, then we need to find the largest
00273        and second largest costs.  Otherwise, we want the total length. */
00274     node = tour->head;
00275     alpha = INT_MIN;
00276     beta = INT_MIN;
00277     *length = 0.0;
00278     while(node != NULL)
00279     {
00280         u = node->data;
00281         if(node->next == NULL)
00282             v = tour->head->data;
00283         else
00284             v = node->next->data;
00285         cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00286 
00287         *length += cost;
00288         if(cost > alpha)
00289         {
00290             beta = alpha;
00291             alpha = cost;
00292         }
00293         else if(cost > beta)
00294         {
00295             beta = cost;
00296         }
00297 
00298         node = node->next;
00299     }
00300     
00301     /* Find the best place to insert the left over nodes */    
00302     for(i = 0; i < list_size; i++)
00303     {
00304         /* Te current node  is v, we want to insert between nodes u and w. */
00305         v = node_list[i];    
00306         
00307         best_cost = DBL_MAX;
00308         node = tour->head;
00309         while(node != NULL)
00310         {
00311             u = node->data;
00312             if(node->next == NULL)
00313                 w = tour->head->data;
00314             else
00315                 w = node->next->data;
00316             
00317             cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, w);
00318             in_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00319             out_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, v, w);
00320             
00321             if(solve_btsp)
00322             {
00323                 if(cost == alpha)
00324                     ins_cost = max3(beta, in_cost, out_cost);
00325                 else
00326                     ins_cost = max3(alpha, in_cost, out_cost);
00327             }
00328             else
00329             {
00330                 ins_cost = *length + in_cost + out_cost - cost;
00331             }
00332             
00333             /* When looking for the best spot to insert v, we keep a list of
00334                all the best spots (in ins_list).  Later on, we'll pick one at 
00335                random */
00336             if(ins_cost < best_cost)
00337             {
00338                 best_cost = ins_cost;
00339                 ins_list[0] = node;
00340                 j = 1;
00341             }
00342             else if(ins_cost == best_cost)
00343             {
00344                 ins_list[j] = node;
00345                 j++;
00346             }
00347             
00348             node = node->next;
00349         }
00350         
00351         /* Of the available spots to place the node, we pick one randomly */
00352         j = arrow_util_random_between(0, j - 1);
00353         node = ins_list[j];
00354         arrow_llist_insert_after(tour, node, v);
00355         
00356         /* Update alpha and beta, and the length */
00357         node = tour->head;
00358         alpha = INT_MIN;
00359         beta = INT_MIN;
00360         *length = 0.0;
00361         while(node != NULL)
00362         {
00363             u = node->data;
00364             if(node->next == NULL)
00365                 w = tour->head->data;
00366             else
00367                 w = node->next->data;
00368             cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, w);
00369             
00370             *length += cost;
00371             if(cost > alpha)
00372             {
00373                 beta = alpha;
00374                 alpha = cost;
00375             }
00376             else if(cost > beta)
00377             {
00378                 beta = cost;
00379             }
00380             
00381             node = node->next;
00382         }
00383     }
00384     
00385     /* If we're solving BTSP, return the length as the largest cost */
00386     if(solve_btsp)
00387     {
00388         *length = alpha;
00389     }
00390 }
00391 
00392 int
00393 min2(int i, int j)
00394 {
00395     int min = i;
00396     if(min > j) min = j;
00397     return min;
00398 }
00399 
00400 int
00401 max2(int i, int j)
00402 {
00403     int max = i;
00404     if(max < j) max = j;
00405     return max;
00406 }
00407 
00408 int
00409 max3(int i, int j, int k)
00410 {
00411     int max = i;
00412     if(max < j) max = j;
00413     if(max < k) max = k;
00414     return max;
00415 }
